key.name: prompt-enabled
key.summary: Prompt the user before completing a connection
key.description: If true, remote users accessing the desktop are not allowed access until the user on the host machine approves the connection. Recommended especially when access is not password protected.

key.name: view-only
key.summary: Only allow remote users to view the desktop
key.description: If true, remote users accessing the desktop are only allowed to view the desktop. Remote users will not be able to use the mouse or keyboard.

key.name: network-interface
key.description:
If not set, the server will listen on all network interfaces.
Set this if you want to accept connections only from some specific network interface. For example, eth0, wifi0, lo and so on.

key.name: use-alternative-port
key.description: If true, the server will listen on another port, instead of the default (5900). The port must be specified in the 'alternative-port' key.

key.name: alternative-port
key.description: The port which the server will listen to if the 'use-alternative-port' key is set to true. Valid values are in the range of 5000 to 50000.

key.name: require-encryption
key.description: If true, remote users accessing the desktop are required to support encryption. It is highly recommended that you use a client which supports encryption unless the intervening network is trusted.

key.name: authentication-methods
key.description:
Lists the authentication methods with which remote users may access the desktop.
There are two possible authentication methods; "vnc" causes the remote user to be prompted for a password (the password is specified by the vnc-password key) before connecting and "none" which allows any remote user to connect.

key.name: vnc-password
key.description:
The password which the remote user will be prompted for if the "vnc" authentication method is used. The password specified by the key is base64 encoded.
The special value of 'keyring' (which is not valid base64) means that the password is stored in the GNOME keyring.

key.name: mailto
key.summary: E-mail address to which the remote desktop URL should be sent
key.description: This key specifies the e-mail address to which the remote desktop URL should be sent if the user clicks on the URL in the Desktop Sharing preferences dialog.

key.name: lock-screen-on-disconnect
key.summary: Lock the screen when last user disconnect
key.description: If true, the screen will be locked after the last remote client disconnects.

key.name: icon-visibility
key.summary: When the status icon should be shown
key.description: This key controls the behavior of the status icon. There are three options: "always" - the icon will always be present; "client" - the icon will only be present when someone is connected (this is the default behavior); "never" - the icon will not be present.

key.name: disable-background
key.summary: Whether to disable the desktop background when a user is connected
key.description: When true, disable the desktop background and replace it with a single block of color when a user successfully connects.

key.name: use-upnp
key.summary: Whether a UPnP router should be used to forward and open ports
key.description: If true, request that a UPnP-capable router should forward and open the port used by Vino.

key.name: disable-xdamage
key.summary: Whether we should disable the XDamage extension of X.org
key.description: If true, do not use the XDamage extension of X.org. This extension does not work properly on some video drivers when using 3D effects. Disabling it will make Vino work in these environments, with slower rendering as a side effect.

key.name: notify-on-connect
key.description: If true, show a notification when a user connects to the system.
